content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #165

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Request event type "switch-organization"

Submitted by Ron Parker on behalf of Kenn Sinn
HL7 Canada (ken.sinn@ehealthontario.on.ca )
Chapter/section: Event Catalog
Url: http://fhircast.org/specification/May2019Ballot/#event-catalog
Type: A-S Enhancement
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary: Request event type "switch-organization"

Comment: Request for a new event "switch-organization", which will require the user to get a new Oauth token and refresh the context. This use-case stems from federated user logins that may be registered or works at multiple hospitals (we call it the UAO - "Under Authority Of"). The change in organization will trigger a new OAuth token to to reflect the change in user's organization, and for subscribers to also refresh the context, to ensure that are accessing FHIR server content using the updated entitlement.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

NiklasSvenzen commented on Issue #165

During conversation at the Montreal, May 2019 working group meeting, @wmaethner , @isaacvetter and myself talked through this issue and would like to:

We really are looking at this type of idea, a specific example is #250

Proposed Resolution: Not persuasive. This is a great idea, just outside of 1.0 scope.

isaacvetter commented on Issue #165

Proposed resolution: Persuasive with Mod.
Create a syntax and process for proposing and defining new events. Remove existing event catalog from base specification.

Related to #228

Moved: Isaac, Ioana Singureanu
Affirmative/Negative/Abstention: 14-0-0

wmaethner labeled Issue #165

isaacvetter edited a comment on Issue #165

## Montreal May 2019 Working Group Vote

@isaacvetter moved the following disposition, seconded by @IoanaSingureanu

Disposition: Persuasive with Mod
Disposition Comment: Create a syntax and process for proposing and defining new events. Remove existing event catalog from base specification. Related to #228

:+1: For: 14
:expressionless: Abstain: 0
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:

wmaethner edited a comment on Issue #165:

## Montreal May 2019 Working Group Vote

@isaacvetter moved the following disposition, seconded by @IoanaSingureanu

Disposition: Persuasive with Mod
Disposition Comment: Create a syntax and process for proposing and defining new events. Remove existing event catalog from base specification. Related to #228, #213

:+1: For: 14
:expressionless: Abstain: 0
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:

wmaethner closed Issue #165:
